posts.post_content: The easiest way I get this card to work is by having an [Embersmith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Embersmith) on the field. Get this guy out there then cast [Caltrops](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Caltrops) for 4 to ping him for one. Then he essentially gains vigilance. If you are sticking with a giant tribal, just use an [Akoum Boulderfoot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Akoum Boulderfoot) or something to ping him (or any other of the previously mentioned combos). Another option is to use [Bullwhip](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bullwhip) (an underrated card imo) to untap and attack with him, or to leave him untapped and use the whip to pull an opponent's creatures to their death. Another easy options is to use a [Furystoke Giant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Furystoke Giant) (again if going tribal). I use a RG Giant deck (well, warrior to be more accurate) and use [Predatory Urge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Predatory Urge) like Donovan\_Fabian mentioned and it works amazingly well. If you can afford it, [Chain Lightning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chain Lightning) is another great option, allowing you to untap him, then hit opponent with it. O... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Arachnos (1/16/2013 1:14:43 PM)

posts.post_content:
I have a casual multiplayer deck where this guy absolutely shines. It's green red, plays both [drumhunter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=drumhunter) and [Exuberant Firestoker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Exuberant Firestoker), and it usually is the first creature out which can activate those secondary abilities.  
More importantly the deck is based on using creature power to fuel burns - [Soul's Fire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul's Fire) and [Warstorm Surge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Warstorm Surge).  
Obviously you would build differently for 1v1 or a less open format, but it works wonders for me. Bet you could find space for it in an EDH deck built on similar terms.
posts.html:
I have a casual multiplayer deck where this guy absolutely shines. It's green red, plays both drumhunter and Exuberant Firestoker, and it usually is the first creature out which can activate those secondary abilities.
More importantly the deck is based on using creature power to fuel burns - Soul's Fire and Warstorm Surge.
Obviously you would build differently for 1v1 or a less open format, but it works wonders for me. Bet you could find space for it in an EDH deck built on similar terms.

posts.post_content:
If you combo him, he's amazing. [Prodigal Pyromancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Prodigal Pyromancer) or the like, and he's a game-winner early on.  
  
However, without the combo, unless your enemy plays a low-damage board clearer or the like, and you can't deal damage to him in any way, he's useless.  
  
4/5 for the combo potential.
posts.html:

However, without the combo, unless your enemy plays a low-damage board clearer or the like, and you can't deal damage to him in any way, he's useless.

4/5 for the combo potential.
